ColorSchemeProvider.description: ColorSchemeProvider is an optional [React context provider](https://reactjs.org/docs/context.html#contextprovider) to enable dark mode.

colorScheme.description: The color scheme for components inside the ColorSchemeProvider. Use 'userPreference' to allow the end user to specify the color scheme via their browser settings, using the 'prefers-color-scheme' media query. See [color scheme](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/colorschemeprovider#Color-scheme) variant for examples.

id.description: An optional id for your color scheme provider. If not passed in, settings will be applied as globally as possible (ex. setting color scheme variables at :root).

DatePicker.description: DatePicker is used when the user has to select a date or date range.

disabled.description: When disabled, DatePicker looks inactive and cannot be interacted with. See the [disabled example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#disabled) to learn more.

errorMessage.description: Provide feedback when an error on selection occurs. See the [error message example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#errorMessage) to learn more.

excludeDates.description: Array of disabled dates. Datepicker can be interacted with except for the dates passed which look inactive and cannot be selected. See the [disabled dates example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#exclude) to learn more.

helperText.description: More information about how to complete the DatePicker field. See the [helper text example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#helperText) to learn more.

id.description: A unique identifier for the input.

idealDirection.description: Preferred direction for the calendar popover to open. See the [ideal direction example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#idealDirection) to learn more.

includeDates.description: Array of enabled dates. Datepicker can be interacted with only on the dates passed, all other dates look inactive and cannot be selected. See the [disabled dates example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#include) to learn more.

label.description: Provide a label to identify the DatePicker field.

localeData.description: DatePicker accepts imported locales from the open source date utility library date-fns. See the [locales example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#localeData) to learn more.

maxDate.description: Disable dates outside a max date. See the [delimited selection period example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#maxMinDates) to learn more.

minDate.description: Disable dates outside a min date. See the [delimited selection period example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#maxMinDates) to learn more.

nextRef.description: Required for date range selection. Pass the complimentary range date picker ref object to DatePicker to autofocus on the unselected date range field. See the [date range picker example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#rangePicker) to learn more.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the user selects a date.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown if the user has not yet input a value. The default placeholder value shows the date format for each locale, e.g. MM/DD/YYYY.

rangeEndDate.description: Required for date range selection. End date on a date range selection. See the [date range picker example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#rangePicker) to learn more.

rangeSelector.description: Required for date range selection. Defines the datepicker start/end role in a date range selection.See the [date range picker example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#rangePicker) to learn more.

rangeStartDate.description: Required for date range selection. Start date on a date range selection. See the [date range picker example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#rangePicker) to learn more.

ref.description: Required for date range selection. Pass a ref object to DatePicker to autofocus on the unselected date range field. See the [date range picker example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#rangePicker) to learn more.

value.description: Pre-selected date value. See the [preselected date example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/datepicker#preselectedValue) to learn more.

OnLinkNavigationProvider.description: OnLinkNavigationProvider is a [React context provider](https://reactjs.org/docs/context.html#contextprovider) to externally control the link behavior of components further down the tree.

  target?: null | 'self' | 'blank',
|}) => ?({|

|}) => void

onNavigation.description: If passed, it replaces the default link behavior with custom on navigation behavior. See [custom navigation context](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/onlinknavigationprovider#Custom-link-navigation-context) variant for examples.

ActivationCard.description: ActivationCards are used in groups to communicate a userâ€™s stage in a series of steps toward an overall action.

dismissButton.description:
Callback fired when the dismiss button is clicked (pressed and released) with a mouse or keyboard.
Supply a short, descriptive label for screen-readers to provide sufficient context about the dismiss button action. IconButtons do not render text for screen readers to read requiring an accessibility label.
Accessibility: `accessibilityLabel` populates aria-label.

message.description: Text to render inside the activation card to convey detailed information to the user. The message text has a fixed size.

|}

link.description:
Link-role button to render inside the activation card as a call-to-action to the user.',
- label: Text to render inside the button to convey the function and purpose of the button. The button text has a fixed size.
- accessibilityLabel: Supply a short, descriptive label for screen-readers to replace button texts that do not provide sufficient context about the button component behavior. Texts like `Click Here,` `Follow,` or `Read More` can be confusing when a screen reader reads them out of context. In those cases, we must pass an alternative text to replace the button text.
- onClick: Callback fired when the button component is clicked (pressed and released) with a mouse or keyboard.
ActivationCard can be paired with OnLinkNavigationProvider. See [OnLinkNavigationProvider](/OnLinkNavigationProvider) to learn more about link navigation.

status.description:
Select the activation card status:
- `notStarted`: A task that has not be started
- `pending`: A task that is pending action
- `needsAttention`: A task that requires the user's attention
- `complete`: A task that has been completed

statusMessage.description: A message to indicate the current status of the activation card.

title.description: Heading to render inside the activation card above the message to convey the activation card topic to the user.

Avatar.description: Avatar is used to represent a user. Every Avatar image has a subtle color wash.

accessibilityLabel.description: String that clients such as VoiceOver will read to describe the element. Will default to `name` prop if not provided.

name.description: The name of the user. This is used for the placeholder treatment if an image is not available.

outline.description: Adds a white border around Avatar so it's visible when displayed on other images.

size.description: xs: 24px, sm: 32px, md: 48px, lg: 64px, xl: 120px. If size is `fit`, Avatar will fill 100% of the parent container width.

src.description: The URL of the user's image.

verified.description: Used to indicate if the user is verified.

AvatarGroup.description: AvatarGroup is used to both display a group of user avatars and, optionally, control actions related to the users group.

accessibilityLabel.description:
Label for screen readers to announce AvatarGroup.

See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Accessibility) for details on proper usage.

accessibilityControls.description:
Specify the `id` of an associated element (or elements) whose contents or visibility are controlled by a component so that screen reader users can identify the relationship between elements. Optional with button-role component.

See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Accessibility) for details on proper usage.

accessibilityExpanded.description:
Indicate that a component hides or exposes collapsible components and expose whether they are currently expanded or collapsed. Optional with button-role component.

See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Accessibility) for details on proper usage.

accessibilityHaspopup.description:
Indicate that a component controls the appearance of interactive popup elements, such as menu or dialog. Optional with button-role component.

See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Accessibility) for details on proper usage.

addCollaborators.description: When supplied, it appends an `add` [icon](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/Icon) to the avatar pile as a call to action to the user. See [Best Practices](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Best-practices) for more info.

collaborators.description: The user group data. See the [collaborators display](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Collaborators-display) variant to learn more.

href.description: When supplied, wraps the component in a link, and directs users to the url when item is selected. See the [role](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Role) variant to learn more.

onClick.description: Callback fired when the component is clicked (pressed and released) with a mouse or keyboard. See the [role](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Role) variant to learn more and see [TapArea's `onTap`](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/taparea#Props-onTap) for more info about `OnTapType`.

ref.description: Forward the ref to the underlying div or anchor element. See the [role](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Role) variant to learn more.

role.description: Allows user interaction with the component. See the [role](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Role) variant to learn more.

size.description: The maximum height of AvatarGroup. If size is `fit`, AvatarGroup will fill 100% of the parent container width. See the [fixed size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Fixed-sizes) and [responsive size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/avatargroup#Responsive-sizing) variant to learn more.

AvatarPair.description: AvatarPair is used to display two avatars in an overlapping grouping.

size.description: md: 48px, lg: 64px. If size is `fit`, AvatarPair will fill 100% of the parent container width.

Badge.description: Badge is used to label text.

position.description: Badge position relative to its parent element.

text.description: Text displayed inside of the Badge. Sentence case is preferred.

Box.description: Box is a component primitive that can be used to build the foundation of pretty much any other component. It keeps details like spacing, borders and colors consistent with the rest of Gestalt, while allowing the developer to focus on the content.

dangerouslySetInlineStyle.description: An "escape hatch" used to apply styles not otherwise available on Box.

alignContent.description:
Aligns a flex container's lines within when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how justify-content aligns individual items within the main-axis.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!
Default: 'stretch'

alignItems.description:
Defines the default behaviour for how flex items are laid out along the cross-axis on the current line. Think of it as the justify-content version for the cross-axis (perpendicular to the main-axis).

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!
Default: 'stretch'

alignSelf.description:
Allows the default alignment (or the one specified by align-items) to be overridden for individual flex items.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!
Default: 'stretch'

as.description:
Changes the underlying DOM element when needed for accessibility or SEO reasons. Note that currently only block-level elements are available.
Default: 'div'

borderStyle.description:
Specify a border style for the box. For sizes, "sm" is 1px and "lg" is 2px. Setting a size will always default the border style to solid and color to lightGray. See the [borders](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Borders) variant for more details.
Default: 'none'

bottom.description:
Helper to specify location when using absolute positioning. See the [absolute positioning](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Absolute-positioning) variant for more info.
Default: false

color.description:
See the [color](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Colors) variant for more info.
Default: 'transparent'

column.description:
See the [column layout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Column-layout) variant for more info.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smColumn`, `mdColumn`, `lgColumn`

smColumn.description: See the [column layout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Column-layout) variant for more info.

mdColumn.description: See the [column layout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Column-layout) variant for more info.

lgColumn.description: See the [column layout](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Column-layout) variant for more info.

direction.description:
Establishes the main-axis, thus defining the direction flex items are placed in the flex container.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!

Also available in responsive sizes: `smDirection`, `mdDirection`, `lgDirection`
Default: 'row'

smDirection.description:
Establishes the main-axis, thus defining the direction flex items are placed in the flex container in sm or larger viewports.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!

mdDirection.description:
Establishes the main-axis, thus defining the direction flex items are placed in the flex container in md or larger viewports.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!

lgDirection.description:
Establishes the main-axis, thus defining the direction flex items are placed in the flex container in lg or larger viewports.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!

display.description:
The display style. See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Visually-hidden-content) to learn more about using \`visuallyHidden\`.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smDisplay`, `mdDisplay`, `lgDisplay`
Default: 'block'

smDisplay.description: The display style in sm or larger viewports. See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Visually-hidden-content) to learn more about using \`visuallyHidden\`.

mdDisplay.description: The display style in md or larger viewports. See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Visually-hidden-content) to learn more about using \`visuallyHidden\`.

lgDisplay.description: The display style in lg or larger viewports. See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Visually-hidden-content) to learn more about using \`visuallyHidden\`.

fit.description:
Sets the max-width of the Box to 100%. See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.
Default: false

flex.description:
Defines how a flex item will be sized. "grow", equivalent to "flex: 1 1 auto", will size the Box relative to its parent, growing and shrinking based on available space. "shrink", equivalent to "flex: 0 1 auto" (the browser default), allows the Box to shrink if compressed but not grow if given extra space. Finally, "none", equivalent to "flex: 0 0 auto", preserves the Box's size based on child content regardless of its container's size.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!
Default: 'shrink'

height.description: Use numbers for pixels: height={100} and strings for percentages: height="100%". See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.

justifyContent.description:
Defines the alignment along the main axis. It helps distribute extra free space left over when either all the flex items on a line are inflexible, or are flexible but have reached their maximum size. It also exerts some control over the alignment of items when they overflow the line.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!
Default: 'start'

left.description:
Helper to specify location when using absolute positioning. See the [absolute positioning](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Absolute-positioning) variant for more info.
Default: false

margin.description:
Scale is in 4px increments so a `margin` of 2 is 8px.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smMargin`, `mdMargin`, `lgMargin`
Default: 0

smMargin.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `margin` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size sm and larger.

mdMargin.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `margin` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size md and larger.

lgMargin.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `margin` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size lg and larger.

marginTop.description:
Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginTop` of 2 is 8px.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smMarginTop`, `mdMarginTop`, `lgMarginTop`
Default: 0

smMarginTop.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginTop` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size sm and larger.

mdMarginTop.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginTop` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size md and larger.

lgMarginTop.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginTop` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size lg and larger.

marginBottom.description:
Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginBottom` of 2 is 8px.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smMarginBottom`, `mdMarginBottom`, `lgMarginBottom`
Default: 0

smMarginBottom.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginBottom` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size sm and larger.

mdMarginBottom.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginBottom` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size md and larger.

lgMarginBottom.description: Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginBottom` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size lg and larger.

marginStart.description:
Applies margin to the left in left-to-right languages, and to the right in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginStart`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginStart` of 2 is 8px.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smMarginStart`, `mdMarginStart`, `lgMarginStart`
Default: 0

smMarginStart.description:
Applies margin to the left in left-to-right languages, and to the right in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginStart`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginStart` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size sm and larger.

mdMarginStart.description:
Applies margin to the left in left-to-right languages, and to the right in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginStart`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginStart` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size md and larger.

lgMarginStart.description:
Applies margin to the left in left-to-right languages, and to the right in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginStart`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a `marginStart` of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size lg and larger.

marginEnd.description:
Applies margin to the right in left-to-right languages, and to the left in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginEnd`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a marginEnd of 2 is 8px.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smMarginEnd`, `mdMarginEnd`, `lgMarginEnd`
Default: 0

smMarginEnd.description:
Applies margin to the right in left-to-right languages, and to the left in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginEnd`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a marginEnd of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size sm and larger.

mdMarginEnd.description:
Applies margin to the right in left-to-right languages, and to the left in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginEnd`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a marginEnd of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size md and larger.

lgMarginEnd.description:
Applies margin to the right in left-to-right languages, and to the left in right-to-left languages. See the [Localization guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Page-direction) to learn more about using `marginEnd`.
Scale is in 4px increments so a marginEnd of 2 is 8px. For viewports of size lg and larger.

maxHeight.description: Use numbers for pixels: maxHeight={100} and strings for percentages: maxHeight="100%". See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.

maxWidth.description: Use numbers for pixels: maxWidth={100} and strings for percentages: maxWidth="100%". See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.

minHeight.description: Use numbers for pixels: minHeight={100} and strings for percentages: minHeight="100%". See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.

minWidth.description: Use numbers for pixels: minWidth={100} and strings for percentages: minWidth="100%". See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smPadding`, `mdPadding`, `lgPadding`

lgPadding.description: Supports 3 responsive breakpoints: sm, md, lg. Each sets the padding from that breakpoint and up. See the [responsive padding](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Responsive-padding) variant for more info.

Horizontal padding (left/right).

Also available in responsive sizes: `smPaddingX`, `mdPaddingX`, `lgPaddingX`
Default: 0

mdPaddingX.description: Horizontal padding (left/right). For viewports of size md and larger.

lgPaddingX.description: Horizontal padding (left/right). For viewports of size lg and larger.

rounding.description: See the [rounding](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Rounding) variant for more info.

top.description:
Helper to specify location when using absolute positioning. See the [absolute positioning](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Absolute-positioning) variant for more info.
Default: false

userSelect.description:
Controls whether or not user can select text.
Default: 'auto'

width.description: Use numbers for pixels: width={100} and strings for percentages: width="100%". See the [sizing](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Sizing) variant for more info.

wrap.description:
By default, flex items will all try to fit onto one line. You can change that and allow the items to wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.

Learn more about Flexbox layouts on [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/CSS/CSS_layout/Flexbox). If you're using Box strictly for Flexbox layouts, check out [Flex](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/flex)!
Default: false

zIndex.description: An object representing the zIndex value of the Box. See the [Z-Index](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/box#Z-Index) variant for more info.

Button.description: Buttons allow users to perform actions within a surface. They can be used alone for immediate action, or as a trigger for another component, like [Dropdown](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown) or [Popover](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover).

ButtonGroup.description: ButtonGroup is used to display a series of buttons.

children.description: One or more Buttons and/or IconButtons.

Callout.description:
Callout is a banner displaying short messages with helpful information for a task on the page, or something that requires the userâ€™s attention.

âš ï¸ Please note: Callout is not currently supported in dark mode.

dismissButton.description:
Adds a dismiss button to Callout. See the [Dismissible variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Dismissible) for more info.
The `accessibilityLabel` should follow the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Accessibility).

iconAccessibilityLabel.description: Label to describe the iconâ€™s purpose. See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Accessibility) for details on proper usage.

message.description:
Main content of Callout. Content should be [localized](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Localization).

See [Best Practices](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Best-practices) for more info.

primaryAction.description:
Main action for users to take on Callout. If `href` is supplied, the action will serve as a link. See [OnLinkNavigationProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout/OnLinkNavigationProvider) to learn more about link navigation.
If no `href` is supplied, the action will be a button.
The `accessibilityLabel` should follow the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Accessibility).

secondaryAction.description:
Secondary action for users to take on Callout. If `href` is supplied, the action will serve as a link. See [OnLinkNavigationProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout/OnLinkNavigationProvider) to learn more about link navigation.
If no `href` is supplied, the action will be a button.
The `accessibilityLabel` should follow the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Accessibility).

type.description: The category of Callout. See [Variants](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Variants) to learn more.

title.description: Brief title summarizing Callout. Content should be [localized](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/callout#Localization).

Card.description: Card is used to highlight content in grids. It visually shows that children elements belong together and can highlight the items on hover.

active.description: Used to force the "active" hover state visually.

image.description: An optional [Image](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image) to be displayed at the top of the layout.

onMouseEnter.description: Optional callback fired when the user mouses over Card.

onMouseLeave.description: Optional callback fired when the user away from Card.

Checkbox.description: Use Checkbox instead of [Switch](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/switch) when displaying 3 or more toggle inputs.

disabled.description: Is the element currently disabled? Disabled Checkboxes do not respond to mouse events and cannot be reached by the keyboard.

errorMessage.description: Displays an error message and error state. Be sure the error message helps the user resolve the problem.

hasError.description: This field is deprecated and will be removed soon. Please do not use.

id.description: A unique identifier for the input.

image.description: An optional Image component can be supplied to add an image to each checkbox. Spacing is already accounted for; simply specify the width and height.

indeterminate.description:
Used to indicate a state that is neither checked nor unchecked â€” e.g. a "Select all" checkbox when not all items are selected or unselected.
Indeterminism is purely presentational - the value of a checkbox and its indeterminism are independent.

label.description: The label for the input. Be sure to localize the text.

name.description: A unique name for the input.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the state of the input changes.

onClick.description: Callback triggered when the user clicks on the input.

ref.description: Ref that is forwarded to the underlying input element.

subtext.description: Optional description for the checkbox, used to provide more detail about an option.

Collage.description: Collage, similarly to [Masonry](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/masonry), creates a deterministic grid layout that can absolutely position and virtualize images.

columns.description: Number of columns (2 - 4). Note that Collage assumes at least 2 * `columns` images will be provided. If fewer images are provided, care will be needed to avoid TypeErrors. See [Columns example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#columns) for more details.

cover.description: Whether or not the first image is a cover image. See [Cover Image example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#coverImage) for more details.

gutter.description: The amount of vertical and horizontal space between images. See [Gutter example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#gutter) for more details.

layoutKey.description: Depending on the number of columns of the collage, there may be multiple layouts available. If there are N layouts available, (layoutKey % N) will determine which layout is used. See [Layout Key example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#layoutKey) for more details.

Column.description: Use Column to implement a 12-column system.

span.description:
The number of units in a 12-unit width that this element will occupy.

Also available in responsive sizes: `smSpan`, `mdSpan`, `lgSpan`

smSpan.description: The number of units in a 12-unit width that this element will occupy in sm and larger viewports.

mdSpan.description: The number of units in a 12-unit width that this element will occupy in md and larger viewports.

lgSpan.description: The number of units in a 12-unit width that this element will occupy in lg and larger viewports.

ComboBox.description: ComboBox is the combination of a [Textfield](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textfield) and an associated [Dropdown](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown) that allows the user to filter a list when selecting an option. ComboBox allows users to type the full option, type part of the option and narrow the results, or select an option from the list.

accessibilityClearButtonLabel.description: Label to describe the clear button's purpose.

disabled.description: When disabled, ComboBox looks inactive and cannot be interacted with. If tags are passed, they will appear disabled as well and cannot be removed. See [tags](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Tags) variant to learn more.

errorMessage.description: Provide feedback when an error on selection occurs. See [error message](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Error-message) variant.

helperText.description: Provides additional information about how to select a ComboBox option.

inputValue.description: The user input in ComboBox for controlled components. See [controlled ComboBox](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Controlled-vs-Uncontrolled) variant to learn more.

id.description: Unique id to identify each ComboBox. Used for [accessibility](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Accessibility) purposes.

label.description: Provide a label to identify the ComboBox field.

labelDisplay.description: Whether the label should be visible or not. If `hidden`, the label is still available for screen reader users, but does not appear visually. See the [label visibility variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Label-visibility) for more info.

noResultText.description: The text shown when the input value returns no matches.

onBlur.description: Callback when you focus outside the component.

onChange.description: Callback when user types into the control input field.

onClear.description: Callback when user clicks on clear button.

onFocus.description: Callback when you focus on the component.

onKeyDown.description: Callback for key stroke events. See [tags](#Tags) variant to learn more.

options.description: The data for each selection option. See [subtext](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#With-subtext) variant to learn more.

placeholder.description: Specify a short description that suggests the expected input for the field.

ref.description: Forward the ref to the underlying component container element. See the [Ref](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Ref) variant to learn more about focus management.

selectedOption.description: The selected option in ComboBox for controlled components. See [controlled ComboBox](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Controlled-vs-Uncontrolled) variant to learn more.

size.description: Defines the height of ComboBox: md: 40px, lg: 48px. Width is defined by parent component.

tags.description: List of tags to display in the component. See [tags](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Tags) variant to learn more.

Container.description: Containers are useful in responsively laying out content on different screens.

Datapoint.description:
Datapoint displays at-a-glance data for a user to quickly view key metrics.

âš ï¸ Please note: Datapoint is not currently supported in dark mode.

size.description: Used to set the size of the datapoint. See the [size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#Size) variant to learn more.

title.description: The header text for the component.

tooltipText.description: Contextual information displayed in a tooltip to describe the Datapoint. See the [tooltipText](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#Tooltip-text) variant to learn more.

trend.description: Object detailing the trend value (change in time - e.g., +30%), and accessibilityLabel to describe the trend's icon (e.g., "Trending up").  See the [trend](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#Trend) variant to learn more.

trendSentiment.description: A visual indicator whether the trend is considered "good", "bad" or "neutral". By setting \`trendSentiment\` to \`auto\`, a positive trend will be considered "good", a negative trend will be considered "bad" and a trend of zero will be considered "neutral".  See the [trendSentiment](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#Trend-sentiment) variant to learn more.

Divider.description: Divider is a light gray 1px horizontal or vertical line which groups and divides content in lists and layouts.

Dropdown.description: Dropdown displays a list of actions, options or links. It is triggered when a user interacts with a Button, Textfield or other control. Dropdown allows for complex functionality that canâ€™t be accomplished with SelectList.

anchor.description: Ref for the element that the Dropdown will attach to, will most likely be a [Button](/button). See the [Accessibility](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Accessibility) guidelines to learn more.

children.description: Must be instances of [Dropdown.Item](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Types-of-items), [Dropdown.Link](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Types-of-items) or [Dropdown.Section](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Sections) components. See the [Types of items](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Types-of-items) variant to learn more.

isWithinFixedContainer.description: Enables correct behavior when Dropdown is used within a fixed container. To achieve this it removes the Layer component around Popover and enables positioning relative to its anchor element. Should only be used in cases where Layer breaks the Dropdown positionings such as when the anchor element is within a sticky component.

headerContent.description: Content to display at the top of the Dropdown before any items or sections. See the [Custom header](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Custom-header) variant to learn more.

id.description: Unique id to identify each Dropdown. Used for [Accessibility](https://gestalt.netlify.app/dropdown#Accessibility) purposes.

idealDirection.description: Preferred direction for the Dropdown to open.

onDismiss.description: Callback fired when the menu is closed.

zIndex.description: An object representing the zIndex value of the Dropdown menu. Learn more about [zIndex classes](https://gestalt.netlify.app/zindex_classes)

DropdownItem.description:
Subcomponent of Dropdown.
  Use [Dropdown.Item](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Types-of-items) for action & selection, when the Dropdown item triggers an action or makes a selection.

badgeText.description: When supplied, will display a [Badge](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/badge) next to the item's label. See the [Badges](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Badges) variant to learn more.

children.description: If needed, users can supply custom content to each Dropdown Item. This can be useful when extra functionality is needed beyond a basic Link. See the [Custom item content](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Custom-item-content) variant to learn more.

dataTestId.description: When supplied, will add a data-test-id prop to the dom element.

selected.description: Either the selected item info or an array of selected items, used to determine when the "selected" icon appears on an item.

index.description: Private prop used for accessibility purposes

DropdownLink.description:
Subcomponent of Dropdown.
   Use [Dropdown.Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Types-of-items) for navigation, when the Dropdown item navigates to a new page.

badgeText.description: When supplied, will display a [Badge](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/badge) next to the item's label. See the [Badges](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Badges) variant to learn more.

children.description: If needed, users can supply custom content to each Dropdown Link. This can be useful when extra functionality is needed beyond a basic Link. See the [Custom item content](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Custom-item-content) variant to learn more.

dataTestId.description: When supplied, will add a data-test-id prop to the dom element.

href.description: Directs users to the url when item is selected. See the [Types of items](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Types-of-items) variant to learn more.

isExternal.description: When true, adds an arrow icon to the end of the item to signal this item takes users to an external source and opens the link in a new tab. Do not add if the item navigates users within the app. See the [Best practices](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Best-practices) for more info.

onClick.description: Callback fired when clicked (pressed and released) with a mouse or keyboard. See [OnLinkNavigationProvider](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/onlinknavigationprovider) to learn more about link navigation.

flowType.raw:

  label: string,
  subtext?: string,
  value: string,
|}

option.description: Object detailing the label, value, and optional subtext for this item.

index.description: Private prop used for accessibility purposes

DropdownSection.description:
Subcomponent of Dropdown.
  Use [Dropdown.Section](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Sections) to create hierarchy within a single Dropdown.

label.description: Label for the section. See the [Sections](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown#Sections) variant for more info.

Fieldset.description: Fieldset creates a fieldset and legend for a group of related form items, like [RadioButtons](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton) or [CheckBoxes](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/checkbox), in order to clearly indicate related form items."

children.description: The content of Fieldset, typically [RadioButtons](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton), [Checkboxes](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/checkbox) or [TextFields](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textfield).

id.description: A unique identifier for this Fieldset. `id` must be specified when an errorMessage is added.

errorMessage.description: When needed, pass a string with a helpful error message (be sure to localize!).

legend.description: Caption that clearly and concisely describes the form elements grouped in the fieldset.

legendDisplay.description: Whether the legend should be visible or not. If `hidden`, the legend is still available for screen reader users, but does not appear visually. See the [legend visibility variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#Legend-visibility) for more info.

Heading.description: Heading allows you to show headings on the page & has a bigger line height than regular text.

accessibilityLevel.description: Allows you to override the default heading level for the given `size`.

align.description: `"start"` and `"end"` should be used for regular alignment since they flip with locale direction. `"forceLeft"` and `"forceRight"` should only be used in special cases where locale direction should be ignored, such as tabular or numeric text. See [Align example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#align) for more details.

color.description: The color of the text. See [Colors example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#colors) for more details.

id.description: A unique identifier for the element.

lineClamp.description: Visually truncate the text to the specified number of lines. This also adds the `title` attribute if `children` is a string, which displays the full text on hover in most browsers. See [Truncation example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#overflowTruncation) for more details.

overflow.description: How truncation is handled when text overflows the line. See [Truncation example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#overflowTruncation) for more details.

size.description:
The font size of the text. See [Sizes example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems#sizes) for more details.
sm: 20px, md: 28px, lg: 36px

Icon.description:
Icons are the symbolic representation of an action or information, providing visual context and improving usability.

See the [Iconography and SVG guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/iconography_and_svgs) to explore the full icon library.

accessibilityLabel.description:
Label for screen readers to announce Icon.

See the [Accessibility guidelines](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/icon#Accessibility) for details on proper usage.

color.description:
These are all the colors available to apply to the Icon; however, we advise only using primary colors within the product to ensure consistency and accessible color contrast.

See the [primary-color combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/icon#Primary-color-combinations) variant to learn more.

icon.description:
SVG icon from the Gestalt icon library to use within Icon..

See the [iconography and SVG](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/iconography_and_svgs) guidelines to explore the Gestalt icon library.

dangerouslySetSvgPath.description:
Defines a new icon different from the built-in Gestalt icons.

See the [custom icon](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/icon#Custom-icon) variant to learn more.

inline.description: Properly positions Icon relative to an inline element, such as Text using the inline property.

size.description:
Use a number for pixel sizes or a string for percentage based sizes.

See the [size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/icon#Size) variant to learn more.

IconButton.description:
IconButton allows users to take actions and make choices with a single click or tap. IconButtons use icons instead of text to convey available actions on a screen. IconButton is typically found in forms, dialogs and toolbars.
 Some buttons are specialized for particular tasks, such as navigation or presenting menus.

Image.description: Image is the workhorse of Pinterest. If you define Pinterest to be all about collecting ideas, then images are how we choose to represent those ideas. In response, we've added a few extra superpowers to the regular img tag to make it even more awesome.

alt.description: Alt text read by screen readers. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLImageElement/alt) for more details.

children.description: Children content will be overlaid on the image.  See the [Overlay example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#Overlay) for more details.

color.description: Used as a visual placeholder while the image is loading.  See the [Placeholders example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#placeholders) for more details.

crossOrigin.description: Specifies the CORS setting to use when retrieving the image. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLImageElement/crossOrigin) for more details.

elementTiming.description: HTML attribute for performance profiling (see https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element_timing_API). Note that it only works if the \`fit\` prop is not set to \`"cover"\` or \`"contain"\`.

fit.description:
Sets how the image is resized to fit its container. See the [Fit example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#fit) for more details.
Note: this doesn't work with srcSet or sizes.

importance.description:
Priority hints provide developers a way to indicate a resource's relative importance to the browser, allowing more control over the order resources are loaded (only available via Chrome Origin Trial). \`"high"\`: the developer considers the resource to be high priority. \`"low"\`: the developer considers the resource to be low priority. \`auto\` the developer does not indicate a preference.
Note that this feature is currently experimental; please see the [attribute spec](https://wicg.github.io/priority-hints/) for more details.

loading.description: Controls if loading the image should be deferred when it's off-screen. \`"lazy"\` defers the load until the image or iframe reaches a distance threshold from the viewport. \`"eager"\` loads the resource immediately. \`"auto"\` uses the default behavior, which is to eagerly load the resource. See the [Lazy example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#Lazy) for more details.

naturalHeight.description: Exact height of source image. See the [Dimensions example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#Dimensions) for more details.

naturalWidth.description: Exact width of source image. See the [Dimensions example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#Dimensions) for more details.

onError.description: Callback fired when the image loading has an error.

onLoad.description: Callback fired when the image successfully loads.

role.description: When Image is used purely as a presentational or decorative addition, the \`role\` should be set to "presentation" for better accessibility. See the [Presentational Images with Role example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image#Presentational-Images-with-Role) for more details.

sizes.description: A comma-separated list of one or more strings indicating a set of source sizes.

srcSet.description: A comma-separated list of one or more strings indicating a set of possible image sources for the user agent to use.

Label.description: Use the Label component to connect a label with a form component in an accessible way.

children.description: The content of the label, typically [Text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/text) or similar.

htmlFor.description: Unique id of the element this label is describing.

Layer.description: Layers allow you to render children outside the DOM hierarchy of the parent. It's a wrapper around React createPortal that lets you use it as a component. This is particularly useful for places you might have needed to use z-index to overlay the screen before.

zIndex.description: An object representing the z-index value of the Layer. See the [z-index example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/layer#zIndex) for more details.

Letterbox.description:
Letterboxes are useful if you have some source media which is larger than the area you want to display it in. For instance, you might have a really tall image and want it to be displayed in a neatly cropped square. While the ideal solution to this problem is to update the source image, this might not always be possible for either cost or performance reasons.

Letterbox should be used in situations where you would otherwise use the CSS property \`background-size: cover\`.

contentAspectRatio.description: Proportional relationship between width and height of element.

Link.description: The Link component allows you to show links on the page, open them in a new window, and change the color.

Mask.description: Mask is used to display content in a specific shape.

height.description: Use numbers for pixels: height={100} and strings for percentages: height="100%".

rounding.description: Specifies the corner radius to apply. See the [Rounding example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/mask#roundingCombinations) for more details.

wash.description: Applies a wash to provide contrast when the masked content is nearly white. See the [Wash example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/mask#wash) for more details.

width.description: Use numbers for pixels: width={100} and strings for percentages: width="100%".

willChangeTransform.description: Mask applies the style `will-change: transform` by default as a performance optimization. In certain specific scenarios, this can be problematic. This prop can be used to turn off that optimization. See the [willChangeTransform example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/mask#willChangeTransform) for more details.

Masonry.description: Masonry creates a deterministic grid layout, positioning items based on available vertical space. It contains performance optimizations like virtualization and support for infinite scrolling.

methods.name: reflow
methods.docblock:
Clear measurements/positions and force a reflow of the entire grid.
Only use this if absolutely necessary - ex: We need to reflow items if the
number of columns we would display should change after a resize.
methods.description:
Clear measurements/positions and force a reflow of the entire grid.
Only use this if absolutely necessary - ex: We need to reflow items if the
number of columns we would display should change after a resize.

columnWidth.description:
The preferred/target item width. If 'flexible' is set, the item width will
grow to fill column space, and shrink to fit if below min columns.

comp.description: A React component (or stateless functional component) that renders the item you would like displayed in the grid. This component is passed three props: the item's data, the item's index in the grid, and a flag indicating if Masonry is currently measuring the item.

flexible.description: Item width will grow to fill column space and shrink to fit if below min columns.

gutterWidth.description: The amount of vertical and horizontal space between each item, specified in pixels.

items.description: An array of items to display that contains the information that `comp` needs to render.

flowType.name: union
flowType.raw:
| typeof DefaultLayoutSymbol
| typeof UniformRowLayoutSymbol
| LegacyMasonryLayout
| LegacyUniformRowLayout
| 'basic'
| 'basicCentered'
| 'flexible'
| 'uniformRow'

layout.description: MasonryUniformRowLayout will make it so that each row is as tall as the tallest item in that row.

loadItems.description:
A callback which the grid calls when we need to load more items as the user scrolls.
The callback should update the state of the items, and pass those in as props
to this component.
Note that `scrollContainer` must be specified.

measurementStore.description: Masonry internally caches item sizes/positions using a measurement store. If `measurementStore` is provided, Masonry will use it as its cache and will keep it updated with future measurements. This is often used to prevent re-measurement when users navigate away and back to a grid. Create a new measurement store with `Masonry.createMeasurementStore()`.

minCols.description: Minimum number of columns to display.

scrollContainer.description:
A function that returns a DOM node that Masonry uses for on-scroll event subscription. This DOM node is intended to be the most immediate ancestor of Masonry in the DOM that will have a scroll bar; in most cases this will be the `window` itself, although sometimes Masonry is used inside containers that have `overflow: auto`. `scrollContainer` is optional, although it is required for features such as `virtualize` and `loadItems`.
This is required if the grid is expected to be scrollable.

virtualBoundsBottom.description: If `virtualize` is enabled, Masonry will only render items that fit in the viewport, plus some buffer. `virtualBoundsBottom` allows customization of the buffer size below the viewport, specified in pixels.

virtualBoundsTop.description: If `virtualize` is enabled, Masonry will only render items that fit in the viewport, plus some buffer. `virtualBoundsTop` allows customization of the buffer size above the viewport, specified in pixels.

virtualize.description: Specifies whether or not Masonry dynamically adds/removes content from the grid based on the user's viewport and scroll position. Note that `scrollContainer` must be specified when virtualization is used.

Modal.description: A Modal displays content that requires user interaction. Modals appear on a layer above the page and therefore block the content underneath, preventing users from interacting with anything else besides the Modal. The most common example of Modal is confirming an action the user has taken.

_dangerouslyDisableScrollBoundaryContain.description: Temporary undocumented prop to disable ScrollBoundaryContainer.

accessibilityModalLabel.description: String that clients such as VoiceOver will read to describe the modal. Always localize the label. See [Accessibility section](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Accessibility) for more info.

align.description: Specify the alignment of `heading` & `subHeading` strings. See the [Heading variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Heading) for more info.

children.description: Supply the element(s) that will be used as Modal's main content. See the [Best Practices](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Best-practices) for more info.

closeOnOutsideClick.description: Close the modal when you click outside of it. See the [outside click variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Preventing-close-on-outside-click) for more info.

footer.description: Supply the element(s) that will be used as Modal's custom footer. See the [Best Practices](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Best-practices) for more info.

heading.description: The text used for Modal's heading. See the [Heading variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Heading) for more info.

onDismiss.description: Callback fired when Modal is dismissed by clicking on the backdrop outside of the Modal (if `closeOnOutsideClick` is true).

role.description:
The underlying ARIA role for the Modal. See the [Accessibility Role section](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Role) for more info.

Default: 'dialog'

size.description:
Determines the width of the Modal. See the [size variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Sizes) for more info.

sm: `540px` | md: `720px` | lg: `900px` | number

Default: 'sm'

subHeading.description: Subtext for Modal, only renders with `heading` strings. See the [sub-heading variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/modal#Sub-heading) for more info.

Module.description: Module is a container that holds content about one subject. Its contents can be visible at all times, or expand and collapse as individual modules or a group of modules.

badgeText.description:
Add a badge displayed after the title. Will not be displayed if `title` is not provided. Not to be used with `icon` or `iconButton`. Be sure to localize the text.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/text#static-badge

children.description:
Content to display underneath Module title

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-default

icon.description:
Name of icon to display in front of title. Will not be displayed if `title` is not provided. Not to be used with `badgeText` or `iconButton`. For a full list of icons, see [Iconography and SVGs](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/iconography_and_svgs#Search-icon-library).

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-icon

iconAccessibilityLabel.description:
Label to provide information about the icon used for screen readers. Can be used in two scenarios: to describe the error icon that appears when `type` is `error`, and to describe the provided `icon` prop when `type` is `info`. Be sure to localize the label.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-icon

iconButton.description:
IconButton element to be placed after the `title` for a supplemental Call To Action (CTA). Will not be displayed if `title` is not provided. Not to be used with `badgeText` or `icon`.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-iconbutton

id.description:
Unique id to identify this Module

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-default

title.description:
Title of this Module. Be sure to localize the text.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-default

type.description:
If set to `error`, displays error icon and changes title to red text. Be sure to provide an `iconAccessibilityLabel` when set to `error`.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/module#static-error

disabled.description: Indicate if the input is disabled.

errorMessage.description: For most use cases, pass a string with a helpful error message (be sure to localize!). In certain instances it can be useful to make some text clickable; to support this, you may instead pass a React.Node to wrap text in [Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/link) or [TapArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/taparea).

helperText.description: More information for the user about how to complete the form field.

id.description: A unique identifier for the input.

label.description: The label for the input. Be sure to localize the text.

max.description: The upper bound of valid input, inclusive.

min.description: The lower bound of valid input, inclusive.

name.description: A unique name for the input.

PageHeader.description: PageHeader is used to indicate the title of the current page, as well as optional actions.

maxWidth.description: Use numbers for pixels: \`maxWidth={100}\` and strings for percentages: \`maxWidth="100%"\`. See the [max width](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pageheader#Max-width) variant for more info.

flowType.name: Element

elements.raw: typeof Button | typeof IconButton | typeof Link | typeof Tooltip

flowType.raw: Element<typeof Button | typeof IconButton | typeof Link | typeof Tooltip>

primaryAction.description: The primary action of the page. Can be [Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/button), [Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/link), [Tooltip](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip) surrounding IconButton or a combination of IconButton, Tooltip and [Dropdown](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown).

secondaryAction.description: A secondary action for the page. Can be [Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/button), [Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/link), [Tooltip](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip) surrounding IconButton or a combination of IconButton, Tooltip and [Dropdown](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/dropdown).

subtext.description: Used for metadata related to the current page, not designed to describe the title or the current surface. Content should be [localized](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pageheader#Localization).

title.description: Page title. Will always be a level 1 heading. Content should be [localized](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pageheader#Localization).

Pog.description:
Pog is a lower-level functional component to show the active, hovered, & focused states of [IconButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog/iconbutton).

This abstraction to allow for links that look like IconButton.

accessibilityLabel.description:
Omit if and only if an ancestor element already has the aria-label set.
This is similar to having [empty alt attributes](https://davidwalsh.name/accessibility-tip-empty-alt-attributes).

active.description: Indicate if Pog is in an active state. See [state combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#stateCombinations) for more details.

bgColor.description: The background color. See [color combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#backgroundColorCombinations) for more details.

dangerouslySetSvgPath.description: Used for custom icons within Pog. Make sure that the viewbox around the SVG path is 24x24.

focused.description: Indicate if Pog is in a focused state. See [state combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#stateCombinations) for more details.

hovered.description: Indicate if Pog is in a hovered state. See [state combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#stateCombinations) for more details.

icon.description: Icon displayed in Pog to convey the behavior of the component. Refer to the [iconography](/iconography_and_svgs#Search-icon-library) guidelines regarding the available icon options.

iconColor.description: Color applied to the [Icon](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog/icon). See [color combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#iconColorCombinations) for more details.

padding.description: Padding in boints. If omitted, padding is derived from the \`size\` prop. See [padding combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#paddingCombinations) for more details.

selected.description: Indicate if Pog is in a selected state. See [state combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#stateCombinations) for more details.

size.description: This controls the icon size and the default padding size. Available sizes are "xs" (12px), "sm" (16px), "md" (18px), "lg" (20px), and "xl" (24px). If padding is omitted, button sizes are "xs" (24px), "sm" (32px), "md" (40px), "lg" (48px), and "xl" (56px). See [size combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/pog#sizeCombinations) for more details.

Popover.description:
Popover is a floating view that contains a task related to the content on screen. It can be triggered when the user clicks or focuses on an element, typically [Button](/button) or [IconButton](/iconbutton). It can also be triggered automatically, as in the case of user education. Popover is non-modal and can be dismissed by interacting with another part of the screen or an item within Popover.

Popover is most appropriate for desktop screens and can contain a variety of elements, such as [Button](/button) and [Images](/image). Popover is also the container used to construct more complex elements like [Dropdown](/dropdown) and the board picker, pictured below, which allow people to choose the board to save a Pin to.

anchor.description: The reference element, typically [Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/button) or [IconButton](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/iconbutton), that Popover uses to set its position.

color.description: The background color of Popover. See the [color and caret](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#Color-and-caret) variant to learn more.

id.description: Unique id to identify each Popover. Used for [accessibility](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#ARIA-attributes) purposes.

idealDirection.description: Specifies the preferred position of Popover relative to its anchor element. See the [ideal direction](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#Ideal-direction) variant to learn more.

onDismiss.description: Callback fired when Popover requests to be closed. Must be used to control Popoverâ€™s on/off display state.

positionRelativeToAnchor.description: Properly positions Popover relative to its anchor element. Set to false when used within [Layer](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/layer). See the [with Layer](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#With-layer) variant to learn more.

role.description: The underlying ARIA role for Popover. See the [accessibility](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#ARIA-attributes) section for more info.

shouldFocus.description: Puts the focus on Popover when itâ€™s triggered. See [accessibility](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#Accessibility) to learn more.

showCaret.description: Shows a caret on Popover. See the [color and caret](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#Color-and-caret) variant to learn more.

size.description: The maximum width of Popover. See the [size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/popover#Size) variant to learn more.

Pulsar.description: Pulsars bring focus to a specific element on the screen and act like training wheels to guide people towards the normal way to perform that action. They are used in isolation or combination with other education components for more instructions.

size.description: The size of the element in pixels.

RadioButton.description: Use RadioButtons when you have a few options that a user can choose from. Never use radio buttons if the user can select more than one option from a list.

checked.description: Indicates if the input is checked. See the [combinations example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton#radio-state-combos) for more details.

disabled.description: Indicates if the input is disabled. See the [combinations example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton#radio-state-combos) for more details.

id.description: A unique identifier for the input.

image.description: An optional [Image](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/image) component can be supplied to add an image to each radio button. Spacing is already accounted for â€” simply specify the width and height. See the [images example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton#images) for more details.

label.description: The displayed label for the input.

name.description: The name given for all radio buttons in a single group.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the user interacts with the input.

ref.description: Ref forwarded to the underlying input element. See [ref example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton#ref) for more details.

subtext.description: Optional description for the input, used to provide more detail about an option. See the [subtext example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/radiobutton#subtext) for more details.

ScrollBoundaryContainer.description: ScrollBoundaryContainer is used with anchored components such as Popover, Tooltip, Dropdown or ComboBox. A ScrollBoundaryContainer is needed for proper positioning when the Tooltip is anchored to an element that is located within a scrolling container. The use of ScrollBoundaryContainer ensures the Tooltip remains attached to its anchor when scrolling.

height.description:
Use numbers for pixels: height={100} and strings for percentages: height="100%".

Overflow property only works for elements with a specified height, however, it is not required if the parent component sets the height.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/text#align

container.description: The scroll container to use. Defaults to window.

SearchField.description: SearchField allows users to search for free-form content.

accessibilityLabel.description: String that clients such as VoiceOver will read to describe the element. Always localize the label. See the [Accessibility section](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/searchfield#Accessibility) for more info.

accessibilityClearButtonLabel.description: String that clients such as VoiceOver will read to describe the clear button element. Always localize the label. See the [Accessibility section](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/searchfield#Accessibility) for more info.

autoComplete.description: The type of autocomplete used, if any. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete) for more info.

errorMessage.description: Error text displayed below the input field.

label.description: Text used to label the input. Be sure to localize the text. See the [Visible label variant](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/searchfield#Visible-label) for more info.

onChange.description: Primary callback to handle keyboard input.

onKeyDown.description: Secondary callback for keyboard events. Possible uses include validation, form submission, etc.

placeholder.description: Text displayed before the user has entered anything.

ref.description: Ref that is forwarded to the underlying input element.

value.description: The current value of the input.

SegmentedControl.description:
SegmentedControl  may be used to group multiple selections. The controls display the current state and related state.

Create layout to convey clear sense of information hierarchy. When a control is engaged, information below the control should also be updated.

items.description: Items for selection. Though typically strings, React.Node is accepted to allow for Icons or other custom UI.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the user selects an item.

responsive.description: By default, items have equal widths. If this prop is true, the width of an item is based on its content. See the [responsive example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/segmentedcontrol#Example:-Responsive) for more details.

selectedItemIndex.description: Index of element in `items` that is currently selected.

SelectList.description: SelectList displays a list of actions or options using the browserâ€™s native select.

disabled.description: Used to disable the entire SelectList.

errorMessage.description: Used to communicate error information to the user. Be sure to localize the text. See the [error message](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/selectlist#Error-message) variant to learn more.

helperText.description: Used to provide more information about the form field. Be sure to localize the text. See the [helper text](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/selectlist#Helper-text) variant to learn more.

id.description: A unique identifier to connect the underlying `<select>` with the associated label.

label.description: The label shown above the input. Be sure to localize the label.

name.description: Used to specify the name of the control.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the user selects a new option.  See the [controlled component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/selectlist#Controlled-component) variant to learn more.

flowType.name: $ReadOnlyArray

elements.name: signature
elements.raw: {| label: string, value: string, disabled?: boolean |}

flowType.raw: $ReadOnlyArray<{| label: string, value: string, disabled?: boolean |}>

options.description: The options displayed in the dropdown list. Note that ``disabled`` here is used to disable a single option. Be sure to localize the label.

placeholder.description: If not provided, the first item in the list will be shown. Be sure to localize the text. See the [controlled component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/selectlist#Controlled-component) variant to learn more.

size.description: md: 40px, lg: 48px. See the [size](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/selectlist#Size) variant to learn more.

value.description: The currently-selected value. See the [controlled component](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/selectlist#Controlled-component) variant to learn more.

Sheet.description: Sheets are surfaces that allow users to view optional information or complete sub-tasks in a workflow while keeping the context of the current page. The most common example of Sheet displays content in a panel that opens from the side of the screen for the user to read or input information. Sheets have default, internal padding for content.

Spinner.description: Spinner helps indicate that a surface's content or portion of content is currently loading.

accessibilityLabel.description: String that clients such as VoiceOver will read to describe the element. Always localize the label.

delay.description: Whether or not to render with a 300ms delay. The delay is for perceived performance, so you should rarely need to remove it.

show.description: Indicates if Spinner should be visible.

Status.description: Status is an indicator with an icon that provides information to a user.

accessibilityLabel.description: If not using `title`, provide an accessibility label to give the user context about the icon. Be sure to [localize](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/status#Localization) the label.

subtext.description: Additional contextual information around the status. Only for use with `title`. See [localization](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/status#Localization) to learn more.

title.description: A label to reinforce the meaning of the status icon. See [localization](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/status#Localization) to learn more.

type.description: The type of status to display.

Sticky.description: Sticky allows an element to become fixed when it reaches a threshold (top, left, bottom, or right).

Switch.description:
Use Switch for single cell options that can be turned on and off only. If you have a cell with multiple options that can activated, consider using [Checkbox](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/checkbox).

Switch supports right-to-left(RTL) language locales layout (auto flip on RTL locales like Arabic).

disabled.description: Indicates if the input is currently disabled. See [Switch combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/switch#switchCombinations) for more details.

id.description: A unique identifier for the element.

name.description: A unique name for the element.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the user interacts with the input.

switched.description: Indicates the current value of the input. See [Switch combinations](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/switch#switchCombinations) for more details.

activeTabIndex.description: The index of the active tab.

bgColor.description: If Tabs is displayed in a container with a colored background, use this prop to remove the white tab background. See the [background color example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tabs#Background-color) to learn more.

wrap.description: By default, tabs will all try to fit onto one line. Use this prop to allow the items to wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.

Tag.description: Tags are objects that hold text and have a delete icon to remove them. They can appear within [TextFields](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textfield#tagsExample), [TextAreas](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textarea#tagsExample), [ComboBox](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/combobox#Tags) or as standalone components.

TapArea.description: TapArea allows components to be clickable and touchable in an accessible way

Text.description: The Text component should be used for all text on the page.

align.description:
`"start"` and `"end"` should be used for regular alignment since they flip with locale direction. `"forceLeft"` and `"forceRight"` should only be used in special cases where locale direction should be ignored, such as tabular or numeric text.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/text#align

lineClamp.description:
Visually truncate the text to the specified number of lines. This also adds the `title` attribute if `children` is a string, which displays the full text on hover in most browsers.

Link: https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/text#overflow

disabled.description: Indicate if the input is currently disabled. See the [disabled example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textArea#disabledExample) for more details.

errorMessage.description: For most use cases, pass a string with a helpful error message (be sure to localize!). In certain instances it can be useful to make some text clickable; to support this, you may instead pass a React.Node to wrap text in Link or TapArea. See the [error message example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textArea#errorMessageExample) for more details.

hasError.description: This field is deprecated and will be removed soon. Please do not use.

helperText.description: More information about how to complete the form field. See the [helper text example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textArea#helperText) for more details.

id.description: A unique identifier for the input.

label.description: The label for the input. Be sure to localize the text.

name.description: A unique name for the input.

onBlur.description: Callback triggered when the user blurs the input.!

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the value of the input changes.

onFocus.description: Callback triggered when the user focuses the input.

onKeyDown.description: Callback triggered when the user presses any key while the input is focused.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown the the user has not yet input a value.

ref.description: Ref that is forwarded to the underlying input element. See the [ref example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textArea#refExample) for more details.

rows.description: Number of text rows to display. Note that tags take up more space, and will show fewer rows than specified.

tags.description: List of tags to display in the component. See the [tags example](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/textArea#tagsExample) for more details.

value.description: The current value of the input.

TextField.description: TextField allows for multiple types of text input.

autoComplete.description: Indicate if autocomplete should be available on the input, and the type of autocomplete.

disabled.description: Indicate if the input is disabled.

errorMessage.description: For most use cases, pass a string with a helpful error message (be sure to localize!). In certain instances it can be useful to make some text clickable; to support this, you may instead pass a React.Node to wrap text in [Link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/link) or [TapArea](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/taparea).

hasError.description: This field is deprecated and will be removed soon. Please do not use.

helperText.description: More information about how to complete the form field.
