label.description: The label for the input. Be sure to localize the text.

name.description: A unique name for the input.

onBlur.description: Callback triggered when the user blurs the input.

onChange.description: Callback triggered when the value of the input changes.

onFocus.description: Callback triggered when the user focuses the input.

onKeyDown.description: Callback triggered when the user presses any key while the input is focused.

placeholder.description: Placeholder text shown the the user has not yet input a value.

ref.description: Ref that is forwarded to the underlying input element.

tags.description: List of tags to display in the component.

type.description: The type of input. For non-telephone numerical input, please use [NumberField](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/numberfield).

Toast.description:
Toasts can educate people on the content of the screen, provide confirmation when people complete an action, or simply communicate a short message.

Toast is purely visual. In order to properly handle the showing and dismissing of Toasts, as well as any animations, you will need to implement a Toast manager.

button.description: Add an optional button for user interaction. Generally not recommended given the ephemeral nature of Toasts.

text.description: Use string for guide toasts (one line of text) and React.Node for confirmation toasts (complex text, potentially containing a Link). Do not specify a Text color within this property, as the color is automatically determined based on the `variant`.

thumbnail.description: An optional thumbnail image to displayed next to the text.

thumbnailShape.description: The masked shape of the thumbnail.

variant.description: Use the `'error'` variant to indicate an error message. Generally not recommended given the ephemeral nature of Toasts.

Tooltip.description: Tooltip is a floating text label that succinctly describes the function of an interactive element, typically [Icon Button](/iconbutton). Itâ€™s displayed continuously as long as the user hovers over or focuses on the element.

accessibilityLabel.description: Label to provide more context around the Tooltipâ€™s function or purpose. By default `text` is used but this prop allows you to override it. Learn more about when to override it in the [Accessibility](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip#Labels) section.

children.description: The anchor element, usually [Icon Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/iconbutton), that triggers Tooltip on hover or focus.

idealDirection.description: Specifies the preferred position of Tooltip relative to its anchor element. See the [ideal direction](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip#Ideal-direction) variant to learn more.

inline.description: Properly positions Tooltip relative to an inline element, such as [Icon Button](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/iconbutton) using the inline property. See the [inline](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip#Inline) variant to learn more.

link.description: Displays a link at the bottom of Tooltip. See the [link](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip#Link) variant to learn more.

text.description: The text shown in Tooltip to describe its anchor element. See [localization ](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip#Localization) to learn more.

zIndex.description: Specifies the stacking order of Tooltip along the z-axis in the current stacking context. See the [z-index](https://gestalt.pinterest.systems/tooltip#Z-index) variant to learn more.

Upsell.description:
Upsells are banners that display short messages that focus on promoting an action or upgrading something the user already has.

âš ï¸ Please note: Upsell is not currently supported in dark mode.

children.description: To create forms within Upsell, pass Upsell.Form as children.

dismissButton.description: Adds a dismiss button to the Upsell. The \`accessibilityLabel\` should follow the [Accessibility guidelines](#Accessibility).

flowType.name: signature
flowType.raw:
{|
  component: Element<typeof Image | typeof Icon>,
  mask?: {|
    rounding?: 'circle' | 0 | 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | 6 | 7 | 8,
    wash?: boolean,
  |},
  width?: number,
|}

imageData.description: Either an [Icon](/icon) or an [Image](/image) to render at the start of the banner. Width is not used with Icon. Image width defaults to 128px. See the [Icon](#Icon) and [Image](#Image) variants for more info.

message.description: Main content of Upsell, explains what is being offered or recommended. Content should be [localized](#Localization). See [Best Practices](#Best-practices) for more info.

>

primaryAction.description:
Main action for people to take on Upsell. If \`href\` is supplied, the action will serve as a link. See [OnLinkNavigationProvider](/onlinknavigationprovider) to learn more about link navigation.'
If no \`href\` is supplied, the action will be a button.
The \`accessibilityLabel\` should follow the [Accessibility guidelines](#Accessibility).

secondaryAction.description:
Secondary action for people to take on Upsell. If \`href\` is supplied, the action will serve as a link. See [OnLinkNavigationProvider](/onlinknavigationprovider) to learn more about link navigation.'
If no \`href\` is supplied, the action will be a button.
The \`accessibilityLabel\` should follow the [Accessibility guidelines](#Accessibility).

title.description: Brief title summarizing the Upsell. Content should be [localized](#Localization).
